eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyInfo: Having survived the crisis, it is time for goodbyes and new journeys.

attributes.content: What a shame that my garden was only half-ruined. This was my opportunity to give it a makeover, but the remaining sculptures and plants got in the way.
attributes.name: Bejeweled Citizen

attributes.content: Repairs are almost complete, though. Would you like to visit?
attributes.name: Bejeweled Citizen

attributes.content: I appreciate the offer, but I'm afraid I must decline for the time being. My gem collection is in disarray, and I need to have each piece appraised individually to restore my centuries-old collection room.
attributes.name: Well-Dressed Citizen

attributes.content: So, about the damage to the museum...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I'll cover it up! If that doesn't work, I'll charm Father with reason and sweet talk! Either way... He will persuade the sponsors.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: And the museum's special new collection?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Don't worry, I'll explain it in my letter.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I don't think Father will allow you to display the ancient architecture that the jewel constructs recreated, though.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I understand. The first duty of the museum is not to display history, but to preserve it... and that includes ensuring that what should remain unseen, remains unseen.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Thank you, Pepe. I can finally sleep well tonight.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I'm the one who should thank you. You and Titi helped me find the gem, we made a historical discovery, and...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Er... Narantuya?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, it's nothing. All that museum talk's gotten me bored, that's all.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I apologize. I invited you here because we wanted to express our gratitude...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Regarding your request to include 'give Ajazi and Ajani special treatment' written into the museum rules, we are currently fulfilling it in a more... subtle manner.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: What are those? Some kind of clay figurine?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: No, two new members of the museum staff.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Two stooges who'll still go to work even if it's hot enough to melt roads.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I will instruct everyone to take good care of them before resigning my post as acting curator.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I still can't believe it, Anat. Are you really giving up your job?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I suppose Father won't be happy with my decision.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: For as long as I can remember, I've watched this city through the window. If it were a book, I think I've finally finished it.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Its history, its past. Its deeply buried secrets, which would have remained hidden if not for adventurers like you charging headlong into them.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Amazing, isn't it? It's only been two days, but the city is already mostly restored to its former state.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: There is still a lot of repair work to do on the houses, and the cracked roads will need to be paved again... but the water supply is clean again.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Of course. The river always flows.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Yes. The river always flows, no matter how many cities turn to sand, and how many more are built upon it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The waters will carry away all. In the face of eternity, it's more of a certainty than a choice.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But eternity has no meaning.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: ...Well, like Titi said, it's not such a bad thing for the museum to have an outlandish exhibition once in a while.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Ha, that I agree.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You know, before coming here, I really did imagine going on a heart-racing adventure.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Of course, it's nothing like what we've been through, just a battle of wits and courage with someone who's after my gems.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pity no one would actually do that to me. Such a shame.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: ...Haha.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Actually, there's one more thing I'd like to ask, Pepe.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You know I'm a huge fan of Dr. Erikson's.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Now that my research on Zubayr is scrapped... I want to see other places on Terra, just like Dr. Erikson did.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I want to compile what I see in letters... and send them to him.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I want to become pen pals with him!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Hey, that's a good reason to leave the museum.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But you faint from heatstroke just by standing too long in the city garden. Shouldn't you get some physical training if you want to do field work?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: That's what I wanted to ask you, Pepe.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: ...Can I travel across Terra in an air-conditioned vehicle?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Sorry, Narantuya, we wanted to go further with you before saying goodbye.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: But we can't be skipping work if we're aiming for employee of the month at the museum.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Plus, this camcorder is really fun—
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Shut up, this video tape is a gift for Narantuya. It's something she'll always carry with her, so be serious.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Hey, Narantuya, we'll throw gold coins into the river if we really miss you.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: I heard the river that flows through the city will reach the ends of the lands, so you can find our gold coins no matter where you go.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Ajani is right.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: I must point out that this river does not flow to Minos, let alone the ends of the lands.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: You didn't HAVE to say it out, you know.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Plus, I'm not planning to go all the way to the ends of the lands.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Speaking of which, why have you decided to abandon them and walk the Khaganquest alone?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I didn't abandon them. The two stooges have finally found where they belong.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I couldn't stick to any of the Khaganquest rules before. Now, I can at least travel around on my own and conveniently call it my Khaganquest.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Saves some effort, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I suspected you were Nightzmora on more than one occasion, but I thought it wasn't something you wanted to talk about.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Hm? I didn't talk about it because there was nothing to talk about. Besides, wouldn't it suck if people remembered me as a Nightzmora and not by my name, Narantuya?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Where does your Khaganquest end?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: According to tradition, the Khaganquest ends at home. But I can't go home because of some things I did a long time ago...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Home?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Yeah. Most people consider the location of their chosen trial to be the destination, but a Khaganquest doesn't end until you complete your trial and return home alive.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: That's the hardest part. A lot of people just keep going further and further away.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I don't like to make things difficult for me. Maybe... I'll call it a day once I find my next subordinate.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...I wish you a smooth journey.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: What about you? Have you had your fill of the museum these few days?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Medjehtiqedti Hanim has kindly granted me access to the parts of the collection not open to public, but the more I see, the more acutely I become aware of the gaps in my knowledge, and in the history of Minos.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: There is nothing more I can do here, after helping them with the writeups for the renovated Minoan exhibit.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I will bring photographs of the collections to Minos and share them with experts. Hopefully, they will be able to prove the existence of competitive philosophical debates in ancient Minos.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: ...After that, I might take the goblet back home.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Oh, speaking of which, I have a present for you.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The convoy will depart soon. Take this and flee... I mean, go back to Minos.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Farewell, friend.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya turns around and, with confident strides, walks away from the setting sun.
As anticipated, she hears Aspasia's exclamation a moment later.
That's the museum's goble—
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Just say 'thank you' and leave with the stuff as quickly as you can.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Don't ask questions.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: ...You really won't ask?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I don't HAVE to, remember?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Thank you, Narantuya. It has been a most rewarding trip.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Cheers.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The convoy rings its bells, a signal for departure. Narantuya waves her hand without turning back.
With my golden blessing, you better win a gold medal.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Speaking of rewards...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: A whole month of hard work, and all I had to show for was that goblet... I guess there was something else too? I don't remember.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...It's ok. It's my choice... I chose this.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: It's just a cup made of gold. There must be so many more waiting for me.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Lazvar, won't you let me perform it for you just this once before you leave?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: I promise I'll swallow your clockwork toy and spit it out whole again, without the slightest bite mark.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: ...It's not as if I could stop you if you really wanted to.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Go on.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: I'm curious if it will grow some real feathers.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Mio just misses you, that's all. No need to let its antics delay you.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Everyone knows the rules of the trading post well now. The Grand Bazaar will select a new overseer, or create a new order. You can leave without worry.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Do you really feel reluctant to part even when your existence is practically eternal?
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Of course! This is the gem trading post of the City of Radiance! I only ever pick the best place to live.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: You could try keeping a real pet. Not Sovereigns of Beasts like Mio and I, or clockwork fowlbeasts.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Successful merchants keep special pets. The minimum standard for you is an albino fowlbeast or a rainbow fin at least three meters long, understood?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Come, let me pet you.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Seemingly reluctant, Mio jumps onto the table in front of the human, lowers its head, and tucks its tail.
(Purrs)
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Farewell, little human.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Farewell.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Sometime later, it opens its eyes again. Certain that no one is watching, its shadow grows to a size far exceeding that of regular cloudbeasts.
...Are you still staying here, then?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Zubayr has found his final rest. The descendant of the Shah has learned the truth of the trove, those whispers that echo through time.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: And you took the Nightzmora to see the treasure, didn't you?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: She had proven her courage by jumping into the waterway depths. Therefore, I fulfilled my promise to Zubayr.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Then I suppose all our promises have been fulfilled, now that Zubayr has passed on.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Those of the present, and those of a thousand years ago. This city no longer has anything to do with the promises we first made.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: But I will stay, for this city is alive.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: I promised to protect the dead, so that they may live again.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: I thought you would miss the City of Gold.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: The city that is now silent? It needs us no longer.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: True. It's as if the entire city has its tongue cut out by the Shahanshah. I don't like it.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: But unlike you, I'm going to see it for myself.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Alright, give me the list of sponsors to visit.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Take inventory of these collections. I'll arrange repairs later.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Hold on, don't send this to the natural exhibits. It's not amber. Didn't you see the fragment of a jewel construct inside?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Just set this aside. Consider it part of my personal collection...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: —Hey, little cloudbeast. Lazvar's, right?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Let me touch your fur, see what comes out of your mouth this time...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Mm. Yeah. Ooh. Just what I wanted.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Yes, I'm talking.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: I've designated you as my keeper. Understood?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: From now on, I tell you where to go.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: You've got a visitor, Pepe.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: One moment... just writing the concluding remarks.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You've been getting an endless stream of visitors since our essay on Zubayr caught the attention of academia and media.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I can decline the requests, if they're bothering you.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: No, it's okay, I can meet them.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I want this essay to reach more people. I want all of Sargon to know Zubayr better.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'll bring her in, then.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Your steps are light, Hanimefendi. I heard the rattling of your accessories, but not a single footstep.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Ah... the honored house of historians... the heir not chosen...
Pardon me, but you're...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I apologize for not introducing myself sooner. I am the herald of the Shahanshah...
I hereby convey to you His Majesty the Shahanshah's gratitude and appreciation for your invaluable contributions to the history of Sargon. I also bring forth the Shahanshah's decree.
attributes.name: Herald of the City of Gold

attributes.content: Hatshepsut. His Majesty awaits your presence in the Shar-Agade, so that he may hear of your exploits in Menat-Ha'mait, in your own words.
attributes.name: Herald of the City of Gold

attributes.content: Kindly make ready and depart without delay. His Majesty eagerly anticipates your arrival.
attributes.name: Herald of the City of Gold
